sentence: Are you still holding shares of home furnishing retailer, Lumber Liquidators Holdings, Inc.LL and waiting for a miracle to take the stock higher in 2016?
If yes, then you might lose more money as chances are very slim that the stock, which lost its value by more than 72% in the past one year, will take a U-turn in the near term.
So it's time to apply what we learnt in our school days, "A stitch in time saves nine", meaning that timely action may prevent a serious loss later on.
Let's analyse and try to find the reason as to what is taking the stock down the hill.

Impact of "60 Minutes" allegations: Lumber Liquidators has been in troubled waters since a report aired on "60 Minutes" on Mar 1, accused the company of selling Chinese flooring laminates containing formaldehyde levels that do not meet California emissions standards.
Formaldehyde is a powerful carcinogen that causes myeloid leukemia and other various cancers and is also known to cause respiratory problems.
Share prices of the company have fallen 100% since the allegations first surfaced.
In October 2015, Lumber Liquidators reached a settlement with the U.S. Department of Justice and to pay $10 million in fines, after pleading guilty to charges related to false import declarations.
The company will plead guilty to violation of the Lacey Act, a conservation law that prohibits import of illegally logged wood.
Dismal Earnings History: These legal troubles have left a serious dent in Lumber Liquidators' bottom and top lines.
The company's bottom line has missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate in the trailing five quarters, with an average earnings miss of a whopping 308.3%.
The company has also not done well on the revenue front as well, missing the Zacks Consensus Estimate in four out of the trailing five quarters.
Downward Estimate Revisions: Let's look at the company's earnings estimate revision which will give a clear picture of what analysts are thinking about the company.
In the past 60 days, the company's loss estimate for 2015 have widened to $1.59 from a loss of $1.25.
On the other hand, in the same time frame the company's loss estimate for the fourth-quarter of 2015 has moved up to a loss of 20 cents from a loss of 5 cents.
Why buy a company that is bogged down by lawsuits and is mending its reputation when there are plenty of other companies not dealing with those issues that have rising earnings estimates?
If you want to own a company in the same space, consider The Home Depot, Inc. HD , Lowe's Companies, Inc. LOW and Beacon Roofing Supply, Inc. BECN .
Beacon Roofing Supply sports a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) whereas The Home Depot and Lowe's hold a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
